intro: Cyanea dentata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cyanea dentata thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, often found in sunny, well-drained soils.
